page.title: 01The Lower Leet Valley
page.content: This block is dominated by Hirsel Law, aerial photography shows an Iron Age Ring Ditch Enclosure on top of it and the Castle Low Mott; is divided by the River Leet and bounded on the South by the River Tweed with is famous salmon fishing. Most of the area is covered by the Hirsel Estate belonging to Lord Home of the Hirsel the former Prime Minister Sir Alec Douglas-Home. The Estate employs 17 people. The land is prime agricultural, grows excellent crops and rears class cattle & sheep. Timber also grows well if carefully started. About a quarter of the Estate is permanently open to the public and includes the internationally famous rhododendron wood, Dundock; a golf course; a small museum, including archaeological finds dating back to 4000 BC; a craft centre; picnic areas & walks. 15000 people visit per annum.
